mission.title: Our Mission
mission.body: Our mission is to strengthen the human capital of the manufacturing industry in Tijuana, B.C. through high-quality training in safety, engineering, human resources, and process optimization. We promote operational excellence, regulatory compliance, and innovation for sustainable growth.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.body: By 2029, we will be leaders in industrial training in Tijuana, B.C., bridging sector needs with global best practices. We foster a safe, efficient, and sustainable ecosystem that strengthens competitiveness and social responsibility.

bullets: Joined Indoff in 1994, founded Indoff de México in 2008 and Indoff University in 2018.
Studied at California State University and University of Wisconsin, Madison.
Recognized by the STPS (Secretariat of Labor and Social Welfare).
37+ years of experience in automation, robotics, and material handling.
Mentor to more than 100 students from UTT, UABC, TEC and CETYS.
Specialist in Lean Manufacturing and productivity.
12+ years of experience in the manufacturing industry.
CETYS graduate, currently pursuing an MBA.
Industrial engineer (University of Sonora).
20+ years in industry; 16 focused on safety.
Project manager at Indoff de México.
8+ years of experience in welding processes and metal manufacturing.
Proficient in standards and advanced techniques.
Graphic designer with 8+ years of experience.
Course content developer for in-person and online training.
B.A. in Communication from UABC.
Advisor in retention strategies and organizational culture.
B.A. in International Business from UABC.
Certified as an STPS instructor.
Customer Service specialist (4+ years of experience).
Electromechanical Engineer from TecNM.
Specialist in electromechanical projects (6+ years).
Member of Indoff de México in material handling projects.
B.S. in Computer Science from CETYS.
STPS certified.
Advanced knowledge in robotics and electronics.
